value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to customize NoSQL data storage and distribution with the Azure portal, Cosmos DB extension, and Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

topItems.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

topItems.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
topItems.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

topItems.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
topItems.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
value.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
value.excerpt: This module is a no-code introduction to PostgreSQL on Azure, including an explanation of particular problems that using Azure Database for PostgreSQL can solve. At a high level, we show how the components fit together and identify situations where you should use Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Deploy a pre-built module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Putting it all together with Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Putting it all together with Azure SQL

value.title: Get Started Querying with Transact-SQL
value.excerpt: Get Started Querying with Transact-SQL

topItems.title: Introduction to Transact-SQL
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to Transact-SQL

topItems.title: Combine multiple tables with JOINs in T-SQL
topItems.excerpt: Combine multiple tables with JOINs in T-SQL

topItems.title: Write Subqueries in T-SQL
topItems.excerpt: Write Subqueries in T-SQL

topItems.title: Use built-in functions and GROUP BY in Transact-SQL
topItems.excerpt: Use built-in functions and GROUP BY in Transact-SQL

value.title: Design a geographically distributed application
value.excerpt: Build an application that spans multiple geographic locations for high availability and resiliency.

value.title: Develop and configure an ASP.NET application that queries an Azure SQL database
value.excerpt: Create an Azure SQL database to store data for an application, and create an ASP.NET application to query data from the database.

value.title: Distribute your data globally with Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Discover the benefits of writing and replicating customized data to regions around the world with Azure Cosmos DB global distribution.

value.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure Learn

topItems.title: Introduction to data platform modernization
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to data platform modernization

topItems.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines

topItems.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases
topItems.excerpt: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases

topItems.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances
topItems.excerpt: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances

value.title: Securely connect IoT devices to the cloud
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path to learn how to securely connect IoT devices with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

topItems.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
topItems.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

topItems.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

value.title: Persist and retrieve relational data with Entity Framework Core
value.excerpt: This module guides you through creating a data access project, connecting to a relational database, and writing CRUD queries.

value.title: Work with mutable and partial data in Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: Learn how to create transactions, manage memory, and use the cache-aside pattern with Azure Cache for Redis

value.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
value.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

value.title: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL

value.title: Back up and restore your Azure SQL database
value.excerpt: Protect the data in your Azure SQL database and recover from data loss or corruption with backup and restore.

value.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

value.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
value.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

value.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API
value.excerpt: By using the Azure Cosmos DB Table API, you will benefit from the low latency, high availability, and scalability of Azure Cosmos DB in a Table storage application.

value.title: How to create an Azure SQL database | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal How To Series, you will learn how to create an Azure SQL Database in the Azure Portal and how you can be more productive in Azure.    Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p7X8lH_XMtI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Java on Azure
value.excerpt: Start here and learn how you can build, migrate and scale Java applications on Azure leveraging Azure services, and using tools and frameworks that you know and love  Spring, Tomcat, WildFly, JBoss, WebLogic, WebSphere, Maven, Gradle, IntelliJ, Eclipse, Jenkins, Terraform etc.

topItems.title: Introduction to Java on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Goal of this module is to welcome you as Java Developers on Azure. In this module, you'll begin to discover the opportunities for Java developers on Azure.

topItems.title: Choose an Azure service for deploying your Java application
topItems.excerpt: In this tutorial, you'll learn about running your Java applications on Azure, and choose the best option between Virtual Machines, Azure App Services, Serverless functions, Kubernetes and Azure Spring Cloud.

topItems.title: Create and deploy a data-driven Spring Boot Java application to Azure App Service with Spring Initializr and Maven
topItems.excerpt: Create a Spring Boot application, connect it to a MySQL database and then deploy to Azure App Service.

topItems.title: Deploy a Java web app to Azure
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn how to create a Java web application and deploy it to Azure App Service.

value.title: Secure your data with Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Secure your data with Azure SQL

value.title: Optimize query performance in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Analyze individual query performance and determine where improvements can be made. Explore performance-related Dynamic Management Objects. Investigate how indexes and database design affect queries.

topItems.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
topItems.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

topItems.title: Evaluate performance improvements
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

topItems.title: Explore performance-based design
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

value.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

value.title: Explore performance-based design
value.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

value.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Use a release approval in Azure Pipelines to help coordinate database schema changes between developers and database administrators.

value.title: Optimize the performance of Azure Cosmos DB by using partitioning and indexing strategies
value.excerpt: Learn how to measure the performance of your NoSQL Azure Cosmos DB database, by monitoring, partitioning, and indexing

value.title: Deploy highly available solutions by using Azure SQL
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to deploy highly available solutions by using Azure SQL. You'll also look at architectures and how they affect availability.

value.title: Evaluate performance improvements
value.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.
